The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. Its fruit is a drupe, typically containing a single seed, and it is adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils. Coptosperma sessiliflorum is often found in coastal and inland dry forests, contributing to local biodiversity.
